name: spoke
description: Mass peer to peer texting tool

ACTION_HANDLERS.description: MISSION CRITICAL: Action handlers are a mechanism in Spoke that allow Spoke to take action when a texter indicates that a contact signalled a certain answer to a question in a Spoke interaction script or the contact has received a certain canned response. EXAMPLES: revere-signup, mobilecommons-signup, actionkit-rspv, ngpvan, civicrm-addtag

CONTACT_LOADERS.description: MISSION CRITICAL: One of the core tasks in a Spoke campaign is loading in the contacts for texters to target. One default and standard way to do so is upload a CSV with their names, cells, zips, and custom fields. EXAMPLES: civicrm, ngpvan, csv-upload

MESSAGE_HANDLERS.description: MISSION CRITICAL: When a message is received from a contact or sent from a texter, message handlers can hook in both right before and right after a message is saved to the database. Before save, you can alter a message's content or details. After save, you can trigger additional actions. It's also possible to block a message from saving. EXAMPLES: initialtext-guard, auto-optout, profanity-tagger, to-ascii, outbound-unassign, ngpvan

SERVICE_MANAGERS.description: MISSION CRITICAL: Service managers often have consequences for your service-vendor -- i.e. they can incur costs or affect how your system works. It's important to understand what a particular service manager does before enabling it -- that is both the power and the risk of these extensions. EXAMPLES: ngpvan, civicrm-donotsms

TEXTER_SIDEBOXES.description: MISSION CRITICAL: Use to support the experience of your volunteer texters. EXAMPLES: celebration-gif,default-dynamicassignment,default-releasecontacts,contact-reference,tag-contact,freshworks-widget,default-editinitial,take-conversations,hide-media,texter-feedback

AUTH0_DOMAIN.description: auth0 domain attached to auth0 account (if not using auth0, enter anything)

AUTH0_CLIENT_ID.description: auth0 client id attached to auth0 account (if not using auth0, enter anything)

AUTH0_CLIENT_SECRET.description: auth0 client secret attached to auth0 account (if not using auth0, enter anything)

AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID.description: in order to export data to an s3 bucket

AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY.description: in order to export data to an s3 bucket

AWS_S3_BUCKET_NAME.description: in order to export data to an s3 bucket

BASE_URL.description: Set this if you are using a custom domain

DB_USE_SSL.description: ensures that the DB is connecting over SSL which is a requirement for Heroku DBs

DEFAULT_TZ.description: Default timezone region for determining timezone when a contact timezone is unavailable. If this is not set, then texting hours will fallback to 12pm Eastern to 9pm Eastern which is the most conservative value for texting hours in the continental US and probably the right default. Only set this if your entire audience is in a single timezone. Example: 'US/Eastern'

DST_REFERENCE_TIMEZONE.description: Timezone to use to determine whether DST is in effect for a date

EMAIL_FROM.description: for email notification integration, the from email address

HEROKU_APP_NAME.description: Name of your Heroku app (not used if BASE_URL is set)

JOBS_SAME_PROCESS.description: recommended setting which means that the same node process that runs the web app processes applications.

KNEX_MIGRATION_DIR.description: sets path for migration directory - do not change

NGP_VAN_DATABASE_MODE.description: typically 0 for MyVoters or 1 for MyCampaign

NODE_ENV.description: node environment determines the application start process

OWNER_CONFIGURABLE.description: Allows organization owners to edit variables

PASSPORT_STRATEGY.description: Either 'auth0' or 'local' -- We recommend auth0 for production systems

PHONE_INVENTORY.description: Enables organization owners to be able to buy Twilio phone numbers within the app

SUPPRESS_MIGRATIONS.description: When updating code, do you want to disable auto-database migrations?

SUPPRESS_SELF_INVITE.description: Should anonymous visitors be able to create new organizations from the home page? You will probably want to start the app with this off, and then after creating your own organization, come back here and set it to 1

TWILIO_ACCOUNT_SID.description: for twilio integration and connected to twilio account

TWILIO_AUTH_TOKEN.description: for twilio integration and connected to twilio account

TWILIO_MULTI_ORG.description: Allows each organization in the Spoke instance to set Twilio variables within the app

TWILIO_VALIDATION.description: Validate twilio message report links.  Add value 1

TWILIO_MESSAGE_SERVICE_SID.description: A twilio service message account SID
